content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

You can define the show method as follows:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

import Base.show

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, string(fwu.value), " ", fwu.unit)
end
```
In this code, we first define the struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit`. Then we import the show method from Base (which Julia uses to display objects). We define a new version of show for FloatWithUnits that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".
